name: Vegan Banana Cream Pie
description: Vegan Banana Cream Pie features a creamy custard filling, plenty of fresh sliced bananas and fluffy vegan whipped topping! Indulgent and delicious.
recipeIngredient: 1  Healthy Vegan Pie Crust ((see below for options))
(1) 13.5 oz can full fat coconut milk, divided
1 container non-dairy whipped cream (I used SoDelicious Coco Whip) ((see below for options))

recipeInstructions.text: Pre-bake Healthy Vegan Pie Crust, then let it cool while you make the custard filling. You could also use my Easy Vegan Pie Crust, or a store bought crust such as a cookie crust.
recipeInstructions.name: Pre-bake Healthy Vegan Pie Crust, then let it cool while you make the custard filling. You could also use my Easy Vegan Pie Crust, or a store bought crust such as a cookie crust.

recipeInstructions.text: In a small bowl, add 1/2 cup of the coconut milk and cornstarch. Stir well and set aside.
recipeInstructions.name: In a small bowl, add 1/2 cup of the coconut milk and cornstarch. Stir well and set aside.

recipeInstructions.text: In a small pot over medium heat, whisk together the rest of the can of coconut milk, sugar and salt. Bring to a gentle simmer.
recipeInstructions.name: In a small pot over medium heat, whisk together the rest of the can of coconut milk, sugar and salt. Bring to a gentle simmer.

recipeInstructions.text: Quickly stir the cornstarch/milk mixture once more, then add it to the pot. Bring the mixture to a boil, whisking frequently for 5-10 minutes, until it starts to thicken. It won't quite look as thick as custard yet, but it will firm up as it cools.
recipeInstructions.name: Quickly stir the cornstarch/milk mixture once more, then add it to the pot. Bring the mixture to a boil, whisking frequently for 5-10 minutes, until it starts to thicken. It won't quite look as thick as custard yet, but it will firm up as it cools.

recipeInstructions.text: Remove from heat, and stir in the coconut oil and vanilla. Pour the custard mixture into the pre-baked and cooled crust. Let cool at room temperature for 10 minutes, then move to the refrigerator and chill for 2-4 hours or overnight. Cover with plastic wrap if desired, to help prevent a film from forming on the custard.

recipeInstructions.text: Once the pie is cool, slice the bananas. Layer most of the banana slices on top of the custard filling, saving some to decorate the top if desired.
recipeInstructions.name: Once the pie is cool, slice the bananas. Layer most of the banana slices on top of the custard filling, saving some to decorate the top if desired.

recipeInstructions.text: Cover the pie with vegan whipped topping. I used SoDelicious Coco Whip. If you can't find a whipped topping at the store, you can make my Vegan Whipped Cream or Coconut Whipped Cream. Decorate with more banana slices right before serving, if desired.

recipeInstructions.text: Serve immediately, and refrigerate any leftovers. The pie will only keep for 1-2 days in the refrigerator.
